result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laterrance D Carr

records.addlTxt:
-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1 On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 1 AMENDED TO ENDANGERING SAFETY BY USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 941.20(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Remains as originally charged.

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in Court.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in Court for Laterrance D Carr.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his/her rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended) Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions, Ineligible Voting Notice.
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights and Addendum; received and filed.
- Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon: Negligent Operation or Handling; received and filed.

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in Court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense receiveddiscovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested a plea date. Case adjourned for Plea hearing Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for September19, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br.46.

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons appeared via zoom.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:    Detective Dustin Frank for Milwaukee Police Department.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is unavailable. State requests an adjournment. Defense does not object for today's appearance. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Fitzsimmons to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Laterrance D Carr
Current: 1916 West Rogers Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 04-22-2022)
Prior: 1916 West Rogers Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Laterrance D Carr in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Laterrance D Carr in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laterrance D Carr appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
